column1: As a Customer Support Specialist at DonorsChoose you'll answer between 60 - 100 emails a day (depending on the day). These inquiries will span a variety of different topics across the entire teacher and donor lifecycles.

You may help a donor navigate our marketplace to support a school in their hometown. Or you may help a teacher get donations multiplied by qualifying for a partner-backed offer. You may walk a mother through surprising her daughter (a first-year teacher!) by fully funding her classroom project. Or you may spend some time tracking down a shipment of live crickets (yikes!) for a sixth grade science class. And sometimes you'll have to do things like explain policies that won't make the customer super happy
column3: or simply help a customer reset a password. It's not all glamor and live insects
column4: but at the end of every day you'll have helped a bunch of people bring joy to a bunch of students!

column1: The Insider Risk Technical Manager – Information Security & Risk Management (ISRM) will play a key role in deploying and developing Johnson & Johnson’s Insider Risk Management Program (IRMP) globally.

Define use cases for the engineering team to develop detection methods and behavioral models to support the discovery of accidental or malicious activities undertaken or soon to be undertaken by insiders that would violate policies or cause harm to J&J.
Establish requirements for the operation of data collection and ingestion into the analytics platform to detect insider risk behaviors.
Review and investigate insider risk alerts and help determine next steps by providing a technically focused perspective on alerts.
Improve and shape the program by identifying gaps in activity logging and communicate requirements and use cases to the engineering teams.
Work closely with the Business Information Security organization to incorporate identified sensitive positions into the risk monitoring workflow.
Operationalize the response workflow following ingestion of logs from systems defined as ‘Crown Jewels’.
Build or update procedural documentation on insider risk detection activities and improvement opportunities.
Partner with other J&J teams to support a coordinated response to insider risk activities including: Employee Relations
column5: Brand Protection and other ISRM teams.

column2: processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. Forensic Analysts exploit captured media and/or investigator computer security incidents in order to derive useful intelligence and/or enable mitigation of network vulnerabilities. column4: and using data and data sources - collecting and analyzing intrusion artifacts (for example
column7: Trojans) to enable mitigation of potential computer network defense incidents within the Global Information Grid - collecting and inspecting forensically sound images to discern possible mitigation/remediation on DoD networks

The department combines one of the nation's leading vision research programs with outstanding clinical care. column3: can correlate malicious behavior across multiple machines

column1: The basic gist of the game is as follows:
User starts the game in a standing position in front of a camera (hardware to be recommended by game developer)
User poses while the camera does facial recognition and records their face for a predetermined number of seconds
User's face is placed on top of the face of a predetermined video. Essentially replacing the face of a character in the provided short video-clip.
